jsonMap.description: This is it. You see the daylight at the end of the cave.

door.description: The golden door looks like it will take you outside!  Freedom is within your grasp!

jsonMap.description:
After unlocking the grand silver door it becomes clear why they key was so coveted. Insede the 
room are perhaps 40 hooded figures all kneeling and praying towards the one object at the end of the room. 
The object is a weapon, same as the one you're holding in fact but also different, more powerful. The do not 
protest as you walk for wards and pick up your new weapon, and as you turn around again to face the quite chanting 
you see they vanished in thin air. Only their robes remain.

door.description: This door is an unnaturally shiny silver, who or what could possible be polishing it?

jsonMap.description:
Standing before you is an ornate gateway that could be marveled as a piece of art if 
it weren't for the tens of broken and dead adventurers representing the danger on the other 
side of the door. Taking a deep breath you open the gates and enter the room.

Whatever this room was used for before it became a decrepit ruin was something sinister. The 
walls are carved with some indecipherable runes and the center of the room has a table clearly made 
for some type of sacrifice, and judging by the size and shape, they preferred human. The ornate 
dagger resting on the center of the table looks to be the tool they used. You reach out to grab it 
to add to your pack but as soon as you touch it you feel as though you grabbed white hot metal. 
After you yelp in pain  and pull back you take a look at what should be a permanently disfigured 
hand only to find it unscathed. You decide it would be best to leave the cursed dagger. 
Unfortunately something may have heard your scream. It would be best to get as far away from this 
room as you can.

The first thing you notice as you enter the room is how dark it is. As a seasoned adventurer 
this shouldn't be anything new, but this is something unnatural. You can barely see your hands in 
front of you let alone whatever dark entity might lurk in here. You suddenly feel very cold, like 
someone is watching you.

Whatever this room was used for before it became a decrepit ruin was something sinister. The 
walls are carved with some indecipherable runes and the center of the room has a table clearly made 
for some type of sacrifice, and judging by the size and shape, they preferred human. The ornate 
dagger resting on the center of the table looks to be the tool they used. You reach out to grab it 
to add to your pack but as soon as you touch it you feel as though you grabbed white hot metal. 
After you yelp in pain  and pull back you take a look at what should be a permanently disfigured 
hand only to find it unscathed. You decide it would be best to leave the cursed dagger. 
Unfortunately something may have heard your scream. It would be best to get as far away from this 
room as you can.

The dilapidated library you entered is filled with books and scrolls ravaged by time. A 
more scholarly type with more time might find ancient tomes and knowledge long forgotten. 
Unfortunately, to you they are nothing more than the cause of an ever invading stench of mold and 
decay. Time to look elsewhere...

The first thing you notice as you enter the room is how dark it is. As a seasoned adventurer 
this shouldn't be anything new, but this is something unnatural. You can barely see your hands in 
front of you let alone whatever dark entity might lurk in here. You suddenly feel very cold, like 
someone is watching you.

The first thing you notice as you enter the room is how dark it is. As a seasoned adventurer 
this shouldn't be anything new, but this is something unnatural. You can barely see your hands in 
front of you let alone whatever dark entity might lurk in here. You suddenly feel very cold, like 
someone is watching you.

Upon stepping into the room you are immediately hit with a putrid stench. Bones scatter the 
ground in front of you so thickly you can't even see the floor. Whatever lives here has quite the 
appetite. Perhaps you shouldn't stay for long.

The dilapidated library you entered is filled with books and scrolls ravaged by time. A 
more scholarly type with more time might find ancient tomes and knowledge long forgotten. 
Unfortunately, to you they are nothing more than the cause of an ever invading stench of mold and 
decay. Time to look elsewhere...

item.name: a heart inside a crystalline container. It still beats.

The dilapidated library you entered is filled with books and scrolls ravaged by time. A 
more scholarly type with more time might find ancient tomes and knowledge long forgotten. 
Unfortunately, to you they are nothing more than the cause of an ever invading stench of mold and 
decay. Time to look elsewhere...

Once again you find yourself face to face with another stone pillar, this time however its 
crumbling. This time you decide not to play its games. With all your might you push the all your might 
and the pillar tips and crashes down. When the dust clears you see a small creature that was crushed 
by the rubble. inside his open chest is a still beating heart.

door.description: The stone door in front of you is immense and made with a solid stone slab.  There is a large slot for a key

this shouldn't be anything new, but this is something unnatural. You can barely see your hands in

The dilapidated library you entered is filled with books and scrolls ravaged by time. A 
more scholarly type with more time might find ancient tomes and knowledge long forgotten. 
Unfortunately, to you they are nothing more than the cause of an ever invading stench of mold and 
decay. Time to look elsewhere...

As you walk into the room you almost fall into the meter and a half long opening to what 
appears to be a pit of considerable depth. Curious, you drop the rest of your half used torch 
down the shaft and watch as the light continues to fall. You continue to watch for perhaps 40 
seconds before the light from your torch is consumed entirely by the darkness. You shiver after 
realizing how close you were to falling in there. Might be best to look for another way out.

Upon stepping into the room you are immediately hit with a putrid stench. Bones scatter the 
ground in front of you so thickly you can't even see the floor. Whatever lives here has quite the 
appetite. Perhaps you shouldn't stay for long.

The dilapidated library you entered is filled with books and scrolls ravaged by time. A 
more scholarly type with more time might find ancient tomes and knowledge long forgotten. 
Unfortunately, to you they are nothing more than the cause of an ever invading stench of mold and 
decay. Time to look elsewhere...

Within the center of the room stands a massive stone pillar reaching towards the top of the 
cavern. On the face of the pillar is a hole that could fit your arm inside. For some strange reason 
you feel drawn towards it and decide it's a good idea to reach inside and pull whatever is inside, out. 
You carefully reach inside and feel around for some mysterious item. Suddenly something grabs back! 
For several moments you try and pull back your arm in vain, when suddenly whatever was holding onto 
you let go. When you go to look at your hand and check if all your digits are still there, you realize 
you're holding onto a key made of stone.

Whatever this room was used for before it became a decrepit ruin was something sinister. The 
walls are carved with some indecipherable runes and the center of the room has a table clearly made 
for some type of sacrifice, and judging by the size and shape, they preferred human. The ornate 
dagger resting on the center of the table looks to be the tool they used. You reach out to grab it 
to add to your pack but as soon as you touch it you feel as though you grabbed white hot metal. 
After you yelp in pain  and pull back you take a look at what should be a permanently disfigured 
hand only to find it unscathed. You decide it would be best to leave the cursed dagger. 
Unfortunately something may have heard your scream. It would be best to get as far away from this 
room as you can.

Sitting upon an alter in the center of the room is a glass case. Inside there is but one item, 
a key. The surrounding room is made up of various religious paraphernalia. It appears this key held some 
sort of religious importance. Regardless it's yours now. You break the glass and stash the key on your belt.

Whatever this room was used for before it became a decrepit ruin was something sinister. The 
walls are carved with some indecipherable runes and the center of the room has a table clearly made 
for some type of sacrifice, and judging by the size and shape, they preferred human. The ornate

walls are carved with some indecipherable runes and the center of the room has a table clearly made 
for some type of sacrifice, and judging by the size and shape, they preferred human. The ornate 
dagger resting on the center of the table looks to be the tool they used. You reach out to grab it

After you yelp in pain  and pull back you take a look at what should be a permanently disfigured 
hand only to find it unscathed. You decide it would be best to leave the cursed dagger. 
Unfortunately something may have heard your scream. It would be best to get as far away from this 
room as you can.

The room would appear rather ordinary except for the large oak tree growing in the center 
of the room. A single skylight shines down upon tree allowing it to grow. You notice a water pail 
beside the tree and decide it probably hasn't been watered in a while. Moments after watering it, 
the ground seems to move. The roots of the tree twist and unravel revealing a health potion.

door.description: The wooden door is worn and rather unimpressive.

jsonMap.description:
The dilapidated library you entered is filled with books and scrolls ravaged by time. A 
more scholarly type with more time might find ancient tomes and knowledge long forgotten. 
Unfortunately, to you they are nothing more than the cause of an ever invading stench of mold and 
decay. Time to look elsewhere...

more scholarly type with more time might find ancient tomes and knowledge long forgotten. 
Unfortunately, to you they are nothing more than the cause of an ever invading stench of mold and 
decay. Time to look elsewhere...

The bottom of a large chasm you were rappelling into. Unfortunately your rope was cut and the it's 
impossible to climb back up. Best to look for another way out

Upon stepping into the room you are immediately hit with a putrid stench. Bones scatter the 
ground in front of you so thickly you can't even see the floor. Whatever lives here has quite the 
appetite. Perhaps you shouldn't stay for long.

Whatever this room was used for before it became a decrepit ruin was something sinister. The

hand only to find it unscathed. You decide it would be best to leave the cursed dagger. 
Unfortunately something may have heard your scream. It would be best to get as far away from this 
room as you can.

It is a simple room. Small and candle light, this room feels more ancient than the others 
you've come across. Someone has lived here and you notice a bed in which lays a mummified 
skeleton gripping an a large wooden key.  Conveniently there appears to be a large carved 
wooden door to the north. Maybe it fits in there?
